page.title: 10TRANSPORT MUSEUM
page.content: During April 1985 the{Edwin Foden {Transport Museum}was opened on the site of Cheshire Leisure,Vicarage Lane, Elworth.It was opened to illustrate the history of Foden vehicles.The 120 year old firm of Fodens ceased to trade in 1979 and sold out to Paccar Ltd.(USA). The firm had previously employed up to 3000 local men manufacturing world famous vehicles.It now employs less than 400.The museum contains an ever changing display of privately lent Foden vehicles,photographic records of the firm and items recording the history of the world famous Fodens Motorworks Brass Band.The museum is run by volunteers who have some association or some interest in Foden vehicles,and it is financed by donations and entrance fees.
